html:
Updated Dec 3, 2024, 12:18 AM UTC

Image: Wizards of the Coast

Ross Miller (he/him) is Polygon’s Senior Commerce Editor for the summer. He has nearly 20 years of experience in media and was a founding editor of The Verge.

Cyber Monday is coming to a close, which means it’s your last chance to get some of the biggest Dungeons & Dragons deals we’ve seen this year.

That includes great deals for first-time adventurers, like 40% off the D&D Essentials Kit, which comes with a rulebook, character sheets, dice, and everything else you need to start your first campaign. Or if you’re shopping for a younger player, The Young Adventurer’s Collection contains four books to help them get started, and is only $15 (was $35).

For more experienced players, you might be interested in the various discounted adventure books or The Making of Original Dungeons & Dragons: 1970-1977, a coffee table book that makes the perfect D&D gift and is currently 50% off. And while not the biggest discount of Cyber Monday, Wizards of the Coast is offering 10% off physical copies of the 2024 Player’s Handbook and the 2024 Dungeon Master’s Guide, both of which launched only a few months ago.

We’ve rounded up even more D&D deals below. But if you see something you like, don’t wait too long to add it to your cart since the hours left in Cyber Monday are ticking by.

$45

The most important book for any D&D adventurer. The 2024 Player’s Handbook is a 384-page treasure and might be the franchise’s high-water mark.

$45

Similar to the new Player’s Handbook, the revised 2024 Dungeon Master’s Guide is designed to better onboard adventurers and, in this case, the Dungeon Master that must emcee all the table’s hijinks.

$15

$45

While this is not a full campaign, the highlight of Fizban’s Treasury of Dragons is the Draconomicon, which will help DMs create the dragon encounter of their dreams, whether it’s a one-shot session or the centerpiece of something much grander.

$34

One of the earliest adventure books of the 2014 / 5th Edition era, Princes of the Apocalypse has everything you need for an adventure aimed at levels 1-15, meaning new heroes who need to test their mettle against cultists and corrupt prophets.

$22

Sword Coast is the home to Baldur’s Gate, Waterdeep, and Neverwinter — all famous locations in their own right. Sword Coast Adventurer’s Guide is less a full campaign and more a sourcebook for DMs and others that may want to tell their own tales in these settings. The book also adds new subclass options like Purple Dragon Knight and Swashbuckler.

$14

Because no one ever has just one hero — at least, just one that survives — this pack of 50 double-sided character sheets comes with an illustrated folder to store them all.

$50

Travel back in time with this enormous tome released to celebrate the game’s 50th anniversary. The book reprints Gary Gygax’s first draft of the game along with the material from its original box set and supplements, with extra context provided by historian Jon Peterson.

$30

Roll20’s Plus tier removes loadscreen ads, allows for unlimited character transfer between games, and adds dynamic lighting. Roll20 Pro, meanwhile, includes everything in the previous Plus tier and also adds monthly rewards, custom character sheets, API / mod access, and more.

$15

This 4-book paperback set is aimed at younger fan and features everything you’d need to make your own adventure, all packaged in a custom slipcase. Books include Monsters & Creatures, Warriors & Weapons, Dungeons & Tomse, and Wizards & Spells.

Looking for more? Check out all of Polygon’s favorite Cyber Monday deals, including great discounts on board games, video games and gaming accessories, Magic: The Gathering, and Legos. And subscribe to our newsletter below to get great deals delivered to your inbox every week.
